sentences.chinese: 神君者，長陵女子，以子死悲哀，故見神於先後宛若。
sentences.literal: Divine Lord was Changling woman, because child died grieved, therefore appeared as spirit to husband Yanruo.
sentences.idiomatic: The Divine Lord was a woman from Changling who, grieving over her dead child, appeared as a spirit to her husband Yanruo.

sentences.chinese: 宛若祠之其室，民多往祠。
sentences.literal: Yanruo sacrificed to her in his chamber, people often went to sacrifice.
sentences.idiomatic: The Divine Lord was a woman from Changling who, grieving over her dead child, appeared as a spirit to her husband Yanruo.

sentences.chinese: 平原君往祠，其後子孫以尊顯。
sentences.literal: Lord of Pingyuan went to sacrifice, afterwards descendants became honored eminent.
sentences.idiomatic: The Divine Lord was a woman from Changling who, grieving over her dead child, appeared as a spirit to her husband Yanruo.

sentences.chinese: 及武帝即位，則厚禮置祠之內中，聞其言，不見其人云。
sentences.literal: When Emperor Wu ascended throne, then treated with great ceremony placed shrine in inner palace, heard her words, did not see her person, it is said.
sentences.idiomatic: The Divine Lord was a woman from Changling who, grieving over her dead child, appeared as a spirit to her husband Yanruo.

sentences.chinese: 是時而李少君亦以祠灶、穀道、卻老方見上，上尊之。
sentences.literal: This time Li Shaojun also with stove sacrifice, grain immortality, ward off old age methods appeared before emperor, emperor honored him.
sentences.idiomatic: The Divine Lord was a woman from Changling who, grieving over her dead child, appeared as a spirit to her husband Yanruo.

sentences.chinese: 少君者，故深澤侯入以主方。
sentences.literal: Shaojun was former Marquis of Shenze's son who entered as master of recipes.
sentences.idiomatic: The Divine Lord was a woman from Changling who, grieving over her dead child, appeared as a spirit to her husband Yanruo.

sentences.chinese: 匿其年及所生長，常自謂七十，能使物，卻老。
sentences.literal: Concealed his age and birthplace, constantly claimed seventy, could manipulate things, ward off old age.
sentences.idiomatic: The Divine Lord was a woman from Changling who, grieving over her dead child, appeared as a spirit to her husband Yanruo.

sentences.literal: His travels with recipes went throughout feudal lords.
sentences.idiomatic: The Divine Lord was a woman from Changling who, grieving over her dead child, appeared as a spirit to her husband Yanruo.
The Divine Lord was a woman from Changling who, grieving over her dead child, appeared as a spirit to her husband Yanruo.

sentences.chinese: 人聞其能使物及不死，更饋遺之，常餘金錢帛衣食。
sentences.literal: People heard his ability to manipulate things and immortality, moreover gave him gifts, constantly had surplus gold money silk clothing food.
sentences.idiomatic: The Divine Lord was a woman from Changling who, grieving over her dead child, appeared as a spirit to her husband Yanruo.

sentences.chinese: 人皆以為不治產業而饒給，又不知其何所人，愈信，爭事之。
sentences.literal: People all thought did not manage property but wealthy, moreover did not know where income came from, became even more believing, competed to serve him.
sentences.idiomatic: The Divine Lord was a woman from Changling who, grieving over her dead child, appeared as a spirit to her husband Yanruo.

sentences.chinese: 少君資好方，善為巧發奇中。
sentences.literal: Shaojun had natural talent for recipes, skilled at making clever discoveries miraculously hit mark.
sentences.idiomatic: The Divine Lord was a woman from Changling who, grieving over her dead child, appeared as a spirit to her husband Yanruo.

sentences.chinese: 嘗從武安侯飲，坐中有年九十餘老人，少君乃言與其大父游射處，老人為兒時從其大父行，識其處，一坐盡驚。
sentences.literal: Once followed Marquis of Wuan drinking, seats had old man ninety remaining years, Shaojun then spoke of places roamed hunted with his grandfather, old man as child followed his grandfather went, recognized places, whole gathering completely astonished.
sentences.idiomatic: The Divine Lord was a woman from Changling who, grieving over her dead child, appeared as a spirit to her husband Yanruo.

sentences.chinese: 少君見上，上有故銅器，問少君。
sentences.literal: Shaojun appeared before emperor, emperor had old bronze vessel, asked Shaojun.
sentences.idiomatic: The Divine Lord was a woman from Changling who, grieving over her dead child, appeared as a spirit to her husband Yanruo.

sentences.chinese: 少君曰：「此器齊桓公十年陳於柏寢。」
sentences.literal: Shaojun said: "This vessel Duke Huan of Qi tenth year displayed in Cypress Chamber."
sentences.idiomatic: The Divine Lord was a woman from Changling who, grieving over her dead child, appeared as a spirit to her husband Yanruo.
